title: SARS-CoV-2 Illumina MiSeq protocol v.2

source.description:
Mix the following components:

Component Volume

50 µM random hexamers

10mM dNTPs mix (10mM each)
Total Mastermix volume

(template RNA)

Total Reaction volume



Prepare Mastermix (1:1) of random hexamers and dNTP.

Mix gently and pulse centrifuge to collect liquid at the bottom of the Mastermix tube.

source.body: The Mastermix should be prepared in a clean room and the nucleic acids added in a BSC or workbench exclusive for RNA work.

source.description:
Aliquot
of this mix into each well of a 96 well plate. Keep the plate in a cold block.

Use multichannel pipette to aliquot
of RNA to the plate from step 2. Seal plate, mix gently on plate mixer, and briefly centrifuge the plate to collect the liquid at bottom of the wells.
Incubate the reaction mix in thermocycler as follows:

Prepare the following mastermix:


Component Volume

SSIV Buffer

100mM DTT

RNaseOUT RNase Inhibitor

SSIV Reverse Transcriptase

Total Mastermix volume
(denatured RNA)

Total Reaction volume



Add
of mastermix to the denatured RNA from the previous step. Cover the plate with seal, mix gently on a plate mixer, and pulse spin the plate to collect liquid at the bottom of the tube.

source.body: The Mastermix should be prepared in in a clean room and added to the denatured RNA in a BSC or workbench exclusive for RNA work.

source.description:
Incubate in a thermocycler as follows:






Hold

Prepare the multiplex PCR reactions as follows and aliquot in each well of a 96-well plate x2 (1 for each pool):


Component Pool 1 Pool 2

5X Q5 Reaction Buffer


10 mM dNTPs


Q5 Hot Start DNA Polymerase

Primer Pool 1 or 2 (10µM)


Nuclease-free water


Total Mastermix volume


(cDNA)


Total reaction volume



Prealiquot
of each mastermix(pool1 and pool2) to each plate (pool1 and pool2) accordingly.

In a BSC or workbench exclusive for RNA work, add
of cDNA from step 6 to each plate. Cover the plate with seal, mix gently on a plate mixer, and pulse spin the plate to collect liquid at the bottom of the tube.

Run the 3.5 hours PCR program for each pool:

Step Temperature Time Cycles

Heat Activation

Annealing

1

Combine the two pools of amplicons:
Add
of each Pool 1 and Pool 2 (total 25μl) in an 0.2 ml PCR plate (low binding plate).
Perform AMPure XP bead cleanup according to directions, as follows.
Quantify amplicons using Qubit dsDNA High Sensitivity kit and plate reader according to directions, as follows.

Create Qubit dsDNA HS working solution by mixing
buffer and
dye (X is the total number of samples, including 6 standards). Using a reservoir and multichannel pipette, dispense
into required number of wells of a Costar 3590 flat-bottom plate (or as appropriate for plate reader).

Dilute the clean, pooled amplicons (from step 11.9) 1:10 by mixing
of the amplicons in
of nuclease free water.

Make up serial standards using 1:2 dilutions of 10 ng/ul stock (Standard 2) from the Qubit HS. This creates 5 standards in the following concentrations:




plus Standard 1
.

Mix
of diluted amplicons and each of the 6 standards
of Qubit HS working solution, mix and breifly centrifuge. Use plate reader to obtain concentration reading for each sample and standards. The Qubit standard curve is generated by the Qubit standards.

Based on the amplicon concentration, normalize of all the samples amplicon concentration to
.
This can be done by adding
of diluted amplicon to a plate with prealiquoted, appropriate amount of nuclease free water.
Prepare sequencing libraries with Nextera XT DNA Library Prep kit at half volume, as follows.

Tagment DNA.
Thaw the following Nextera XT reagents on ice:
Amplicon tagment mix (ATM)
Tagment DNA buffer (TD)
Nextera PCR master mix (NPM)
Thaw the index primers, mix by vortex each vial and spin down the liquid at the bottom of the vials.
Neutralization buffer (NT) at

PCR Amplification.
Thaw the following reagents on ice:
NMP
Index primers

Invert all reagents 3 - 5 times, followed by pulse spin.

Clean Up Libraries
Repeat the same clean up process as step 11 using
of AMPure XP beads and
of resuspension buffer.
Repeat the same quantification process as Step 16 but do NOT dilute libraries.
Verify fragment size and concentration using Agilent D5000 Assay on TapeStation 4200 as follows.

Normalize each library to
by dilution with nuclease free water.

Pool equal volume (e.g.
) from each of the normalized libraries into a single
microtube.
Denature and load pooled libraries as follows.

Add
of AMPure XP beads(well-vortexed and at
) to the combined amplicons plate. Cover the plate with seal, mix gently on a plate mixer, and pulse spin the plate to collect liquid at the bottom of the tube. Incubate at
for
.

Transfer
of the clear supernatant to a new plate, ensuring no beads are transferred.

Place the plate on magnetic rack and incubate for
to
or until the beads have pelleted and the supernatant is completely clear.

Remove from magnetic rack, add
of EB buffer to wells and mix gently on a plate mixer, ensuring beads are well re-suspended. Briefly centrifuge the plate to collect the liquid at the bottom of the wells. Incubate at
for
.

Discard all ethanol and carefully remove as much residual ethanol as possible using a multichannel pipette. With the plate uncovered, incubate for 3-5 min or until the pellet loses its shine (if the pellet dries completely it will crack and become difficult to resuspend).
Repeat ethanol wash (step 11.3 and 11.4).

Add
of freshly prepared,
80% ethanol to each well, incubate for
, remove the ethanol carefully with a multichannel pipette.
Remove and discard the liquid from each well with a multichannel pippette, being careful not to touch the bead pellet.

Place the plate on a magnetic rack for
, or until the beads have pelleted and the supernatant is completely clear.
Use remaining volumes from Pool 1 and Pool 2 to confirm amplification (step 9). Make 1% agarose gels with enough wells for all samples.
Load 2 l of the 100 bp ladder into gel on either side of each row of wells.
Dispense 2 l of 6X loading dye into each sample with a multichannel pipette, mix and load 2 l of this mix into the gel.

Run at 240V for
. Visualize PCR products, confirm bands of approximately 300bp size.

Add the following reagents in order:
of TD buffer
of
amplicon (from step 17)
of ATM

Cover plate with plate seal, mix gently on plate mixer and centrifuge for 1 min.

Incubate in thermocycler with the following steps:



hold

Remove the plate immediately once thermocycler reachs
, and proceed to neutralization.
Add
of NT buffer to each well and mix by pipetting up and down for 3 times, briefly spin down the plate and incubate at
for
.
Add 7.5 μl of Nextera PCR mastermix to each well.

From the pre-aliquoted index plate, add
(
of each i5 and i7 index of the corresponding index combination to each well. Cover plate with plate seal, gently mix on plate mixer, and centrifuge for 1 min.

Run the PCR program to amplify the libraries:

Step Temperature Time Cycles

1

1

Hold 1
Add 2 μl of Sample Buffer and 2 μl of your pooled libraries in triplicate in a strip tube.
Vortex using the adapter at 2000 rpm for 1 min.

Load tubes, tapes, and tips. Start run. Using library concentration and fragment size, calculate the molarity of the libraries using the following formula:
Molarity = concentration ng/uL * (1515.1515/fragment size(bp))

Denature the pooled libraries by mixing
of pooled libraries and
of freshly made 0.2N NaOH solution.
Incubate for
.

Add
of HT1 buffer and mix well with denatured pooled library by pipetting up and down 10 times with P1000.

Load
of the denatured, diluted pooled library into the loading position of the Illumina reagent cartridge (V2, 300 cycle kit). Load reagent cartridge, flow cell, and PR2 buffer into Miseq instrument, confirm the metrics and start the run.

description: ARTIC amplicon sequencing protocol adapted from Josh Quick's https://www.protocols.io/view/ncov-2019-sequencing-protocol-v2-bdp7i5rn for illumina sequencing of SARS-CoV-2
